1.name: bulbasaur
1.que: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this POKéMON.

2.name: ivysaur
2.que: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

3.name: venusaur
3.que: The plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

4.name: charmander
4.que: Obviously prefers hot places. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

5.name: charmeleon
5.que: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the temperature to unbearably high levels.

6.name: charizard
6.que: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to cause forest fires unintentionally.

7.name: squirtle
7.que: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. Powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.

8.name: wartortle
8.que: Often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. For swimming fast, it moves its ears to maintain balance.

9.name: blastoise
9.que: A brutal POKéMON with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high speed tackles.

11.name: metapod
11.que: This POKéMON is vulnerable to attack while its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.

12.name: butterfree
12.que: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

13.name: weedle
13.que: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp venomous stinger on its head.

14.name: kakuna
14.que: Almost incapable of moving, this POKéMON can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.

15.name: beedrill
15.que: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.

16.name: pidgey
16.que: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

17.name: pidgeotto
17.que: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this POKéMON will fiercely peck at any intruder.

18.name: pidgeot
18.que: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as MAGIKARP.

21.name: spearow
21.que: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.

22.name: fearow
22.que: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.

23.name: ekans
23.que: Moves silently and stealthily. Eats the eggs of birds, such as PIDGEY and SPEAROW, whole.

24.name: arbok
24.que: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area.

25.name: pikachu
25.que: When several of these POKéMON gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.

26.name: raichu
26.que: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.

27.name: sandshrew
27.que: Burrows deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.

28.name: sandslash
28.que: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.

29.name: nidoran-f
29.que: Although small, its venomous barbs render this POKéMON dangerous. The female has smaller horns.

30.name: nidorina
30.que: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.

31.name: nidoqueen
31.que: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.

32.name: nidoran-m
32.que: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger its horns, the more powerful its secreted venom.

34.name: nidoking
34.que: It uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break the prey's bones.

35.name: clefairy
35.que: Its magical and cute appeal has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.

36.name: clefable
36.que: A timid fairy POKéMON that is rarely seen. It will run and hide the moment it senses people.

37.name: vulpix
37.que: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.

38.name: ninetales
38.que: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1000-year curse.

39.name: jigglypuff
39.que: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

40.name: wigglytuff
40.que: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.

42.name: golbat
42.que: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.

43.name: oddish
43.que: During the day, it keeps its face buried in the ground. At night, it wanders around sowing its seeds.

44.name: gloom
44.que: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn't drool. It is a nectar that is used to attract prey.

45.name: vileplume
45.que: It has the world’s largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

46.name: paras
46.que: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by draw­ ing nutrients from the bug host.

47.name: parasect
47.que: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.

48.name: venonat
48.que: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats insects. It is attracted by light at night.

49.name: venomoth
49.que: The dustlike scales covering its wings are color-coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.

51.name: dugtrio
51.que: A team of DIGLETT triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.

52.name: meowth
52.que: It washes its face regularly to keep the coin on its forehead spotless. It doesn’t get along with Galarian Meowth.

53.name: persian
53.que: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.

54.name: psyduck
54.que: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily POKéMON will use psychokinetic powers.

55.name: golduck
55.que: Often seen swim­ ming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.

56.name: mankey
56.que: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment then thrashing away the next instant.

57.name: primeape
57.que: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it is caught.

58.name: growlithe
58.que: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.

59.name: arcanine
59.que: A POKéMON that has been admired since the past for its beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.

60.name: poliwag
60.que: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming than trying to stand.

61.name: poliwhirl
61.que: Capable of living in or out of water. When out of water, it sweats to keep its body slimy.

62.name: poliwrath
62.que: An adept swimmer at both the front crawl and breast stroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.

63.name: abra
63.que: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and TELEPORT to safety.

64.name: kadabra
64.que: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches just by being close by.

65.name: alakazam
65.que: Its brain can out­ perform a super­ computer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5,000.

67.name: machoke
67.que: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

68.name: machamp
68.que: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.

69.name: bellsprout
69.que: A carnivorous POKéMON that traps and eats bugs. It uses its root feet to soak up needed moisture.

70.name: weepinbell
70.que: It spits out POISONPOWDER to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of ACID.

72.name: tentacool
72.que: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.

73.name: tentacruel
73.que: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.

74.name: geodude
74.que: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

76.name: golem
76.que: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.

77.name: ponyta
77.que: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything completely flat in little time.

80.name: slowbro
80.que: The SHELLDER that is latched onto SLOWPOKE's tail is said to feed on the host's left over scraps.

81.name: magnemite
81.que: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses THUNDER WAVE and similar moves.

82.name: magneton
82.que: Formed by several MAGNEMITEs linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

83.name: farfetchd
83.que: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. It is used much like a metal sword.

84.name: doduo
84.que: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.

86.name: seel
86.que: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice.

87.name: dewgong
87.que: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.

88.name: grimer
88.que: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.

89.name: muk
89.que: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

90.name: shellder
90.que: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

91.name: cloyster
91.que: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.

92.name: gastly
92.que: Almost invisible, this gaseous POKéMON cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.

93.name: haunter
93.que: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from an­ other dimension.

94.name: gengar
94.que: Under a full moon, this POKéMON likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.

95.name: onix
95.que: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, but colored black.

96.name: drowzee
96.que: Puts enemies to sleep then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.

97.name: hypno
97.que: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of PSI moves such as HYPNOSIS and CONFUSION.

98.name: krabby
98.que: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.

99.name: kingler
99.que: The large pincer has 10000 hp of crushing power. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use.

100.name: voltorb
100.que: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a POKé BALL, they have zapped many people.

101.name: electrode
101.que: It stores electric energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

102.name: exeggcute
102.que: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.

103.name: exeggutor
103.que: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an EXEGGCUTE.

104.name: cubone
104.que: Because it never removes its skull helmet, no one has ever seen this POKéMON's real face.

106.name: hitmonlee
106.que: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.

107.name: hitmonchan
107.que: While apparently doing nothing, it fires punches in lightning fast volleys that are impossible to see.

108.name: lickitung
108.que: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon's. It leaves a tingling sensation when it licks enemies.

109.name: koffing
109.que: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning.

110.name: weezing
110.que: Where two kinds of poison gases meet, 2 KOFFINGs can fuse into a WEEZING over many years.

111.name: rhyhorn
111.que: A POKéMON with a one-track mind. Once it charges,  it won't stop running until it falls asleep.

112.name: rhydon
112.que: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees.

113.name: chansey
113.que: A rare and elusive POKéMON that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to get it.

114.name: tangela
114.que: The whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to sea­ weed. Its vines shake as it walks.

115.name: kangaskhan
115.que: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother's protective pouch until it is 3 years old.

116.name: horsea
116.que: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.

117.name: seadra
117.que: Capable of swim­ ming backwards by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.

118.name: goldeen
118.que: Its tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname of the Water Queen.

119.name: seaking
119.que: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.

120.name: staryu
120.que: If its body is torn, it can grow back if the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.

121.name: starmie
121.que: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.

122.name: mr-mime
122.que: If interrupted while it is miming, it will slap around the offender with its broad hands.

123.name: scyther
123.que: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one.

124.name: jynx
124.que: It seductively wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.

125.name: electabuzz
125.que: Normally found near power plants, they can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.

126.name: magmar
126.que: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.

127.name: pinsir
127.que: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing it around and toss it hard.

128.name: tauros
128.que: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.

129.name: magikarp
129.que: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.

130.name: gyarados
130.que: Once it begins to rampage, a GYARADOS will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.

131.name: lapras
131.que: A POKéMON that has been over­ hunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across the water.

132.name: ditto
132.que: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.

133.name: eevee
133.que: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element STONEs.

134.name: vaporeon
134.que: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin which is often mistaken for a mermaid's.

135.name: jolteon
135.que: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10000- volt lightning bolts.

136.name: flareon
136.que: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature could soar to over 1600 degrees.

137.name: porygon
137.que: A POKéMON that consists entirely of programming code. Capable of moving freely in cyberspace.

138.name: omanyte
138.que: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.

139.name: omastar
139.que: A prehistoric POKéMON that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible to catch prey.

140.name: kabuto
140.que: A POKéMON that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.

142.name: aerodactyl
142.que: A Pokémon that roamed the skies in the dinosaur era. Its teeth are like saw blades.

143.name: snorlax
143.que: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

144.name: articuno
144.que: A legendary bird POKéMON that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

146.name: moltres
146.que: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.

147.name: dratini
147.que: Long considered a mythical POKéMON until recently when a small colony was found living underwater.

149.name: dragonite
149.que: An extremely rarely seen marine POKéMON. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.

150.name: mewtwo
150.que: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene splicing and DNA engineering experiments.

151.name: mew
151.que: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.

152.name: chikorita
152.que: A sweet aroma gently wafts from the leaf on its head. It is docile and loves to soak up the sun's rays.

153.name: bayleef
153.que: The scent of spices comes from around its neck. Somehow, sniffing it makes you want to fight.

154.name: meganium
154.que: The aroma that rises from its petals contains a substance that calms aggressive feelings.

155.name: cyndaquil
155.que: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.

156.name: quilava
156.que: Be careful if it turns its back during battle. It means that it will attack with the fire on its back.

157.name: typhlosion
157.que: If its rage peaks, it becomes so hot that anything that touches it will instantly go up in flames.

158.name: totodile
158.que: Its well-developed jaws are powerful and capable of crushing anything. Even its trainer must be careful.

159.name: croconaw
159.que: If it loses a fang, a new one grows back in its place. There are always 48 fangs lining its mouth.

160.name: feraligatr
160.que: When it bites with its massive and powerful jaws, it shakes its head and savagely tears its victim up.

161.name: sentret
161.que: A very cautious POKéMON, it raises itself up using its tail to get a better view of its surroundings.

162.name: furret
162.que: It makes a nest to suit its long and skinny body. The nest is impossible for other POKéMON to enter.

163.name: hoothoot
163.que: It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so fast, the movement can rarely be seen.

164.name: noctowl
164.que: Its eyes are specially adapted. They concentrate even faint light and enable it to see in the dark.

165.name: ledyba
165.que: It is very timid. It will be afraid to move if it is alone. But it will be active if it is in a group.

166.name: ledian
166.que: When the stars flicker in the night sky, it flutters about, scattering a glowing powder.

167.name: spinarak
167.que: It lies still in the same pose for days in its web, waiting for its unsuspecting prey to wander close.

169.name: crobat
169.que: It flies so si­ lently through the dark on its four wings that it may not be noticed even when nearby.

170.name: chinchou
170.que: Chinchou blink their shining antennae at one another to claim their respective turf.

171.name: lanturn
171.que: The light it emits is so bright that it can illuminate the sea's surface from a depth of over three miles.

172.name: pichu
172.que: It is not yet skilled at storing electricity. It may send out a jolt if amused or startled.

173.name: cleffa
173.que: Because of its unusual, star-like silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.

174.name: igglybuff
174.que: It has a very soft body. If it starts to roll, it will bounce all over and be impossible to stop.

175.name: togepi
175.que: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.

176.name: togetic
176.que: They say that it will appear before kindhearted, car­ ing people and shower them with happiness.

177.name: natu
177.que: Because its wings aren't yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always star­ ing at something.

178.name: xatu
178.que: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.

179.name: mareep
179.que: If static elec­ tricity builds in its body, its fleece doubles in volume. Touching it will shock you.

181.name: ampharos
181.que: The tail's tip shines brightly and can be seen from far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.

182.name: bellossom
182.que: Plentiful in the tropics. When it dances, its petals rub together and make a pleasant ringing sound.

183.name: marill
183.que: The tip of its tail, which con­ tains oil that is lighter than wa­ ter, lets it swim without drowning.

184.name: azumarill
184.que: It lives in water virtually all day long. Its body color and pattern act as camouflage that makes it tough for enemies to spot in water.

185.name: sudowoodo
185.que: Although it always pretends to be a tree, its composi­ tion appears to be closer to a rock than a plant.

186.name: politoed
186.que: If POLIWAG and POLIWHIRL hear its echoing cry, they respond by gather­ ing from far and wide.

187.name: hoppip
187.que: To keep from being blown away by the wind, they gather in clusters. They do enjoy gentle breezes, though.

188.name: skiploom
188.que: The bloom on top of its head opens and closes as the temperature fluc­ tuates up and down.

189.name: jumpluff
189.que: Once it catches the wind, it deft­ ly controls its cotton-puff spores to float, even around the world.

191.name: sunkern
191.que: It may drop out of the sky suddenly. If attacked by a SPEAROW, it will violently shake its leaves.

192.name: sunflora
192.que: It converts sun­ light into energy. In the darkness after sunset, it closes its petals and becomes still.

193.name: yanma
193.que: If it flaps its wings really fast, it can generate shock waves that will shatter win­ dows in the area.

194.name: wooper
194.que: This POKéMON lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.

195.name: quagsire
195.que: This carefree POKéMON has an easy-going nature. While swimming, it always bumps into boat hulls.

196.name: espeon
196.que: It uses the fine hair that covers its body to sense air currents and predict its ene­ my's actions.

197.name: umbreon
197.que: When agitated, this POKéMON pro­ tects itself by spraying poisonous sweat from its pores.

198.name: murkrow
198.que: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.

199.name: slowking
199.que: It has incredible intellect and in­ tuition. Whatever the situation, it remains calm and collected.

200.name: misdreavus
200.que: It likes playing mischievous tricks such as screaming and wailing to startle people at night.

201.name: unown
201.que: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tab­ lets. It is said that the two are somehow related.

203.name: girafarig
203.que: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent and bite.

204.name: pineco
204.que: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn't bother it.

205.name: forretress
205.que: Its entire body is shielded by a steel-hard shell. What lurks inside the armor is a total mystery.

206.name: dunsparce
206.que: When spotted, this POKéMON escapes backward by furi­ ously boring into the ground with its tail.

207.name: gligar
207.que: It flies straight at its target's face then clamps down on the star­ tled victim to inject poison.

208.name: steelix
208.que: It is thought its body transformed as a result of iron accumulating internally from swallowing soil.

209.name: snubbull
209.que: Although it looks frightening, it is actually kind and affectionate. It is very popular among women.

210.name: granbull
210.que: It is actually timid and easily spooked. If at­ tacked, it flails about to fend off its attacker.

211.name: qwilfish
211.que: To fire its poison spikes, it must inflate its body by drinking over 2.6 gallons of water all at once.

212.name: scizor
212.que: It has a steel-hard body. It intimidates foes by upraising its eye-patterned pincers.

213.name: shuckle
213.que: The BERRIES it stores in its vase-like shell decompose and become a gooey liquid.

214.name: heracross
214.que: It is usually docile, but if it is disturbed while sipping honey, it chases off the intruder with its horn.

216.name: teddiursa
216.que: If it finds honey, its crescent mark glows. It always licks its paws because they are soaked with honey.

217.name: ursaring
217.que: Although it is a good climber, it prefers to snap trees with its forelegs and eat fallen BERRIES.

219.name: magcargo
219.que: The shell on its back is just skin that has cooled and hardened. It breaks easily with a slight touch.

220.name: swinub
220.que: It rubs its snout on the ground to find and dig up food. It sometimes discovers hot springs.

221.name: piloswine
221.que: Because the long hair all over its body obscures its sight, it just keeps charging repeatedly.

222.name: corsola
222.que: It continuously sheds and grows. The tip of its head is prized as a treasure for its beauty.

223.name: remoraid
223.que: It has superb ac­ curacy. The water it shoots out can strike even moving prey from more than 300 feet.

224.name: octillery
224.que: It traps enemies with its suction- cupped tentacles then smashes them with its rock-hard head.

225.name: delibird
225.que: It carries food all day long. There are tales about lost people who were saved by the food it had.

226.name: mantine
226.que: As it majestically swims, it doesn't care if REMORAID attach to it for scavenging its leftovers.

227.name: skarmory
227.que: Its sturdy wings look heavy, but they are actually hollow and light, allowing it to fly freely in the sky.

228.name: houndour
228.que: It uses different kinds of cries for communicating with others of its kind and for pursuing its prey.

229.name: houndoom
229.que: If you are burned by the flames it shoots from its mouth, the pain will never go away.

230.name: kingdra
230.que: It is said that it usually hides in underwater caves. It can create whirlpools by yawning.

231.name: phanpy
231.que: It swings its long snout around play­ fully, but because it is so strong, that can be dan­ gerous.

232.name: donphan
232.que: It has sharp, hard tusks and a rugged hide. Its TACKLE is strong enough to knock down a house.

233.name: porygon2
233.que: This upgraded version of PORYGON is designed for space exploration. It can't fly, though.

234.name: stantler
234.que: The curved antlers subtly change the flow of air to create a strange space where real­ ity is distorted.

235.name: smeargle
235.que: A special fluid oozes from the tip of its tail. It paints the fluid everywhere to mark its territory.

236.name: tyrogue
236.que: It is always bursting with en­ ergy. To make it­ self stronger, it keeps on fighting even if it loses.

237.name: hitmontop
237.que: If you become enchanted by its smooth, elegant, dance-like kicks, you may get drilled hard.

238.name: smoochum
238.que: Its lips are the most sensitive parts on its body. It always uses its lips first to examine things.

240.name: magby
240.que: Each and every time it inhales and exhales, hot embers dribble out of its mouth and nostrils.

242.name: blissey
242.que: Anyone who takes even one bite of BLISSEY's egg be­ comes unfailingly caring and pleas­ ant to everyone.

243.name: raikou
243.que: The rain clouds it carries let it fire thunderbolts at will. They say that it descended with lightning.

244.name: entei
244.que: Volcanoes erupt when it barks. Un­ able to restrain its extreme power, it races headlong around the land.

245.name: suicune
245.que: It races around the world to purify fouled water. It dashes away with the north wind.

246.name: larvitar
246.que: It feeds on soil. After it has eaten a large mountain, it will fall asleep so it can grow.

247.name: pupitar
247.que: Its shell is as hard as sheet rock, and it is also very strong. Its THRASHING can topple a mountain.

248.name: tyranitar
248.que: Its body can't be harmed by any sort of attack, so it is very eager to make challenges against enemies.

249.name: lugia
249.que: It is said that it quietly spends its time deep at the bottom of the sea because its powers are too strong.

250.name: ho-oh
250.que: Legends claim this POKéMON flies the world's skies con­ tinuously on its magnificent seven- colored wings.

251.name: celebi
251.que: This POKéMON wan­ ders across time. Grass and trees flourish in the forests in which it has appeared.

252.name: treecko
252.que: TREECKO has small hooks on the bottom of its feet that enable it to scale vertical walls. This POKéMON attacks by slamming foes with its thick tail.

254.name: sceptile
254.que: The leaves growing on SCEPTILE’s body are very sharp edged. This POKéMON is very agile - it leaps all over the branches of trees and jumps on its foe from above or behind.

255.name: torchic
255.que: TORCHIC sticks with its TRAINER, following behind with unsteady steps. This POKéMON breathes fire of over 1,800 degrees F, including fireballs that leave the foe scorched black.

256.name: combusken
256.que: COMBUSKEN toughens up its legs and thighs by running through fields and mountains. This POKéMON’s legs possess both speed and power, enabling it to dole out ten kicks in one second.

257.name: blaziken
257.que: In battle, BLAZIKEN blows out intense flames from its wrists and attacks foes courageously. The stronger the foe, the more intensely this POKéMON’s wrists burn.

258.name: mudkip
258.que: The fin on MUDKIP’s head acts as highly sensitive radar. Using this fin to sense movements of water and air, this POKéMON can determine what is taking place around it without using its eyes.

259.name: marshtomp
259.que: The surface of MARSHTOMP’s body is enveloped by a thin, sticky film that enables it to live on land. This POKéMON plays in mud on beaches when the ocean tide is low.

260.name: swampert
260.que: SWAMPERT is very strong. It has enough power to easily drag a boulder weighing more than a ton. This POKéMON also has powerful vision that lets it see even in murky water.

261.name: poochyena
261.que: At first sight, POOCHYENA takes a bite at anything that moves. This POKéMON chases after prey until the victim becomes exhausted. However, it may turn tail if the prey strikes back.

263.name: zigzagoon
263.que: ZIGZAGOON restlessly wanders everywhere at all times. This POKéMON does so because it is very curious. It becomes interested in anything that it happens to see.

264.name: linoone
264.que: LINOONE always runs full speed and only in straight lines. If facing an obstacle, it makes a right-angle turn to evade it. This POKéMON is very challenged by gently curving roads.

266.name: silcoon
266.que: SILCOON tethers itself to a tree branch using silk to keep from falling. There,  this POKéMON hangs quietly while it awaits evolution. It peers out of the silk cocoon through a small hole.

267.name: beautifly
267.que: BEAUTIFLY’s favorite food is the sweet pollen of flowers. If you want to see this POKéMON, just leave a potted flower by an open window. BEAUTIFLY is sure to come looking for pollen.

268.name: cascoon
268.que: CASCOON makes its protective cocoon by wrapping its body entirely with a fine silk from its mouth. Once the silk goes around its body, it hardens. This POKéMON prepares for its evolution inside the cocoon.

269.name: dustox
269.que: DUSTOX is instinctively drawn to light. Swarms of this POKéMON are attracted by the bright lights of cities, where they wreak havoc by stripping the leaves off roadside trees for food.

270.name: lotad
270.que: It searches about for clean water. If it does not drink water for too long, the leaf on its head wilts.

271.name: lombre
271.que: It lives at the water’s edge where it is sunny. It sleeps on a bed of water grass by day and becomes active at night.

272.name: ludicolo
272.que: LUDICOLO begins dancing as soon as it hears cheerful, festive music. This POKéMON is said to appear when it hears the singing of children on hiking outings.

273.name: seedot
273.que: SEEDOT attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. It sucks moisture from the tree while hanging off the branch. The more water it drinks, the glossier this POKéMON’s body becomes.

274.name: nuzleaf
274.que: NUZLEAF live in densely overgrown forests. They occasionally venture out of the forest to startle people. This POKéMON dislikes having its long nose pinched.

275.name: shiftry
275.que: It lives quietly in the deep forest. It is said to create chilly winter winds with the fans it holds.

276.name: taillow
276.que: TAILLOW courageously stands its ground against foes, however strong they may be. This gutsy POKéMON will remain defiant even after a loss. On the other hand, it cries loudly if it becomes hungry.

277.name: swellow
277.que: SWELLOW flies high above our heads, making graceful arcs in the sky. This POKéMON dives at a steep angle as soon as it spots its prey. The hapless prey is tightly grasped by SWELLOW’s clawed feet, preventing escape.

278.name: wingull
278.que: WINGULL has the habit of carrying prey and valuables in its beak and hiding them in all sorts of locations. This POKéMON rides the winds and flies as if it were skating across the sky.

279.name: pelipper
279.que: It is a messenger of the skies, carrying small Pokémon and eggs to safety in its bill.

280.name: ralts
280.que: RALTS senses the emotions of people using the horns on its head. This POKéMON rarely appears before people. But when it does, it draws closer if it senses that the person has a positive disposition.

281.name: kirlia
281.que: It is said that a KIRLIA that is exposed to the positive emotions of its TRAINER grows beautiful. This POKéMON controls psychokinetic powers with its highly developed brain.

282.name: gardevoir
282.que: GARDEVOIR has the ability to read the future. If it senses impending danger to its TRAINER, this POKéMON is said to unleash its psychokinetic energy at full power.

284.name: masquerain
284.que: MASQUERAIN intimidates enemies with the eyelike patterns on its antennas. This POKéMON flaps its four wings to freely fly in any direction - even sideways and backwards - as if it were a helicopter.

285.name: shroomish
285.que: SHROOMISH live in damp soil in the dark depths of forests. They are often found keeping still under fallen leaves. This POKéMON feeds on compost that is made up of fallen, rotted leaves.

287.name: slakoth
287.que: SLAKOTH lolls around for over twenty hours every day. Because it moves so little, it does not need much food. This POKéMON’s sole daily meal consists of just three leaves.

288.name: vigoroth
288.que: VIGOROTH is always itching and agitated to go on a wild rampage. It simply can’t tolerate sitting still for even a minute. This POKéMON’s stress level rises if it can’t be moving constantly.

289.name: slaking
289.que: SLAKING spends all day lying down and lolling about. It eats grass growing within its reach. If it eats all the grass it can reach, this POKéMON reluctantly moves to another spot.

290.name: nincada
290.que: NINCADA lives underground for many years in complete darkness. This POKéMON absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees. It stays motionless as it waits for evolution.

291.name: ninjask
291.que: NINJASK moves around at such a high speed that it cannot be seen, even while its crying can be clearly heard. For that reason, this POKéMON was long believed to be invisible.

292.name: shedinja
292.que: SHEDINJA’s hard body doesn’t move - not even a twitch. In fact, its body appears to be merely a hollow shell. It is believed that this POKéMON will steal the spirit of anyone peering into its hollow body from its back.

293.name: whismur
293.que: Normally, WHISMUR’s voice is very quiet - it is barely audible even if one is paying close attention. However, if this POKéMON senses danger, it starts crying at an earsplitting volume.

294.name: loudred
294.que: LOUDRED’s bellowing can completely decimate a wood-frame house. It uses its voice to punish its foes. This POKéMON’s round ears serve as loudspeakers.

295.name: exploud
295.que: EXPLOUD triggers earthquakes with the tremors it creates by bellowing. If this POKéMON violently inhales from the ports on its body, it’s a sign that it is preparing to let loose a huge bellow.

296.name: makuhita
296.que: MAKUHITA is tenacious - it will keep getting up and attacking its foe however many times it is knocked down. Every time it gets back up, this POKéMON stores more energy in its body for evolving.

297.name: hariyama
297.que: It has the habit of challenging others without hesitation to tests of strength. It’s been known to stand on train tracks and stop trains using forearm thrusts.

298.name: azurill
298.que: A Pokémon that lives by water. It moves quickly on land by bouncing on its big tail.

299.name: nosepass
299.que: NOSEPASS’s magnetic nose is always pointed to the north. If two of these POKéMON meet, they cannot turn their faces to each other when they are close because their magnetic noses repel one another.

300.name: skitty
300.que: SKITTY has the habit of becoming fascinated by moving objects and chasing them around. This POKéMON is known to chase after its own tail and become dizzy.

301.name: delcatty
301.que: DELCATTY prefers to live an unfettered existence in which it can do as it pleases at its own pace. Because this POKéMON eats and sleeps whenever it decides, its daily routines are completely random.

302.name: sableye
302.que: SABLEYE lead quiet lives deep inside caverns. They are feared, however, because these POKéMON are thought to steal the spirits of people when their eyes burn with a sinister glow in the darkness.

303.name: mawile
303.que: MAWHILE’s huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed. Its docile-looking face serves to lull its foe into letting down its guard. When the foe least expects it, MAWHILE chomps it with its gaping jaws.

304.name: aron
304.que: This POKéMON has a body of steel. To make its body, ARON feeds on iron ore that it digs from mountains. Occasionally, it causes major trouble by eating bridges and rails.

305.name: lairon
305.que: LAIRON tempers its steel body by drinking highly nutritious mineral springwater until it is bloated. This POKéMON makes its nest close to springs of delicious water.

306.name: aggron
306.que: AGGRON claims an entire mountain as its own territory. It mercilessly beats up anything that violates its environment. This POKéMON vigilantly patrols its territory at all times.

308.name: medicham
308.que: It is said that through meditation, MEDICHAM heightens energy inside its body and sharpens its sixth sense. This POKéMON hides its presence by merging itself with fields and mountains.

309.name: electrike
309.que: ELECTRIKE stores electricity in its long body hair. This POKéMON stimulates its leg muscles with electric charges. These jolts of power give its legs explosive acceleration performance.

310.name: manectric
310.que: MANECTRIC is constantly discharging electricity from its mane. The sparks sometimes ignite forest fires. When it enters a battle, this POKéMON creates thunderclouds.

311.name: plusle
311.que: PLUSLE always acts as a cheerleader for its partners. Whenever a teammate puts out a good effort in battle, this POKéMON shorts out its body to create the crackling noises of sparks to show its joy.

312.name: minun
312.que: MINUN is more concerned about cheering on its partners than its own safety. It shorts out the electricity in its body to create brilliant showers of sparks to cheer on its teammates.

313.name: volbeat
313.que: With the arrival of night, VOLBEAT emits light from its tail. It communicates with others by adjusting the intensity and flashing of its light. This POKéMON is attracted by the sweet aroma of ILLUMISE.

314.name: illumise
314.que: With its sweet aroma, it guides Volbeat to draw signs with light in the night sky.

315.name: roselia
315.que: ROSELIA shoots sharp thorns as projectiles at any opponent that tries to steal the flowers on its arms. The aroma of this POKéMON brings serenity to living things.

316.name: gulpin
316.que: Virtually all of GULPIN’s body is its stomach. As a result, it can swallow something its own size. This POKéMON’s stomach contains a special fluid that digests anything.

318.name: carvanha
318.que: CARVANHA’s strongly developed jaws and its sharply pointed fangs pack the destructive power to rip out boat hulls. Many boats have been attacked and sunk by this POKéMON.

319.name: sharpedo
319.que: Nicknamed “the bully of the sea,” SHARPEDO is widely feared. Its cruel fangs grow back immediately if they snap off. Just one of these POKéMON can thoroughly tear apart a supertanker.

320.name: wailmer
320.que: WAILMER’s nostrils are located above its eyes. This playful POKéMON loves to startle people by forcefully snorting out seawater it stores inside its body out of its nostrils.

321.name: wailord
321.que: WAILORD is the largest of all identified POKéMON up to now. This giant POKéMON swims languorously in the vast open sea, eating massive amounts of food at once with its enormous mouth.

322.name: numel
322.que: NUMEL is extremely dull witted - it doesn’t notice being hit. However, it can’t stand hunger for even a second. This POKéMON’s body is a seething cauldron of boiling magma.

323.name: camerupt
323.que: CAMERUPT has a volcano inside its body. Magma of 18,000 degrees F courses through its body. Occasionally, the humps on this POKéMON’s back erupt, spewing the superheated magma.

324.name: torkoal
324.que: You can tell how it’s feeling by the smoke spouting from its shell. Tremendous velocity is a sign of good health.

325.name: spoink
325.que: SPOINK bounces around on its tail. The shock of its bouncing makes its heart pump. As a result, this POKéMON cannot afford to stop bouncing - if it stops, its heart will stop.

326.name: grumpig
326.que: GRUMPIG uses the black pearls on its body to amplify its psychic power waves for gaining total control over its foe. When this POKéMON uses its special power, its snorting breath grows labored.

327.name: spinda
327.que: No two Spinda have the same pattern of spots. Its tottering step fouls the aim of foes.

328.name: trapinch
328.que: TRAPINCH’s nest is a sloped, bowl-like pit dug in sand. This POKéMON patiently waits for prey to tumble down the pit. Its giant jaws have enough strength to crush even boulders.

330.name: flygon
330.que: FLYGON is nicknamed “the elemental  spirit of the desert.” Because its flapping wings whip up a cloud of sand, this POKéMON is always enveloped in a sandstorm while flying.

332.name: cacturne
332.que: During the daytime, CACTURNE remains unmoving so that it does not lose any moisture to the harsh desert sun. This POKéMON becomes active at night when the temperature drops.

333.name: swablu
333.que: SWABLU has light and fluffy wings that are like cottony clouds. This POKéMON is not frightened of people. It lands on the heads of people and sits there like a cotton-fluff hat.

335.name: zangoose
335.que: Memories of battling its arch-rival SEVIPER are etched into every cell of ZANGOOSE’s body. This POKéMON adroitly dodges attacks with incredible agility.

336.name: seviper
336.que: SEVIPER shares a generations-long feud with ZANGOOSE. The scars on its body are evidence of vicious battles. This POKéMON attacks using its sword- edged tail.

337.name: lunatone
337.que: LUNATONE was discovered at a location where a meteorite fell. As a result, some people theorize that this POKéMON came from space. However, no one has been able to prove this theory so far.

338.name: solrock
338.que: Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is strong during the daytime. When it spins, its body shines.

339.name: barboach
339.que: BARBOACH’s sensitive whiskers serve as a superb radar system. This POKéMON hides in mud, leaving only its two whiskers exposed while it waits for prey to come along.

340.name: whiscash
340.que: WHISCASH is extremely territorial. Just one of these POKéMON will claim a large pond as its exclusive territory. If a foe approaches it, it thrashes about and triggers a massive earthquake.

341.name: corphish
341.que: Its hardy vitality enables it to adapt to any environment. Its pincers will never release prey.

342.name: crawdaunt
342.que: CRAWDAUNT has an extremely violent nature that compels it to challenge other living things to battle. Other life-forms refuse to live in ponds inhabited by this POKéMON, making them desolate places.

343.name: baltoy
343.que: BALTOY moves while spinning around on its one foot. Primitive wall paintings depicting this POKéMON living among people were discovered in some ancient ruins.

344.name: claydol
344.que: CLAYDOL are said to be dolls of mud made by primitive humans and brought to life by exposure to a mysterious ray. This POKéMON moves about while levitating.

345.name: lileep
345.que: LILEEP became extinct approximately a hundred million years ago. This ancient POKéMON attaches itself to a rock on the seafloor and catches approaching prey using tentacles  shaped like flower petals.

346.name: cradily
346.que: CRADILY roams around the ocean floor in search of food. This POKéMON freely extends its tree trunk-like neck and captures unwary prey using its eight tentacles.

347.name: anorith
347.que: ANORITH was regenerated from a prehistoric fossil. This primitive POKéMON once lived in warm seas. It grips its prey firmly between its two large claws.

348.name: armaldo
348.que: ARMALDO’s tough armor makes all attacks bounce off. This POKéMON’s two enormous claws can be freely extended or contracted. They have the power to punch right through a steel slab.

349.name: feebas
349.que: FEEBAS’s fins are ragged and tattered from the start of its life. Because of its shoddy appearance, this POKéMON is largely ignored. It is capable of living in both the sea and in rivers.

351.name: castform
351.que: CASTFORM’s appearance changes with the weather. This POKéMON gained the ability to use the vast power of nature to protect its tiny body.

352.name: kecleon
352.que: It changes body color to blend in with its surroundings. It also changes color if it is happy or sad.

353.name: shuppet
353.que: SHUPPET is attracted by feelings of jealousy and vindictiveness. If someone develops strong feelings of vengeance, this POKéMON will appear in a swarm and line up beneath the eaves of that person’s home.

354.name: banette
354.que: BANETTE generates energy for laying strong curses by sticking pins into its own body. This POKéMON was originally a pitiful plush doll that was thrown away.

355.name: duskull
355.que: DUSKULL can pass through any wall no matter how thick it may be. Once this POKéMON chooses a target, it will doggedly pursue the intended victim until the break of dawn.

356.name: dusclops
356.que: DUSCLOPS’s body is completely hollow - there is nothing at all inside. It is said that its body is like a black hole. This POKéMON will absorb anything into its body, but nothing will ever come back out.

358.name: chimecho
358.que: CHIMECHO makes its cries echo inside its hollow body. When this POKéMON becomes enraged, its cries result in ultrasonic waves that have the power to knock foes flying.

359.name: absol
359.que: Every time ABSOL appears before people, it is followed by a disaster such as an earthquake or a tidal wave. As a result, it came to be known as the disaster POKéMON.

360.name: wynaut
360.que: WYNAUT can always be seen with a big, happy smile on its face. Look at its tail to determine if it is angry. When angered, this POKéMON will be slapping the ground with its tail.

361.name: snorunt
361.que: SNORUNT live in regions with heavy snowfall. In seasons without snow, such as spring and summer, this POKéMON steals away to live quietly among stalactites and stalagmites deep in caverns.

362.name: glalie
362.que: GLALIE has a body made of rock, which it hardens with an armor of ice. This POKéMON has the ability to freeze moisture in the atmosphere into any shape it desires.

363.name: spheal
363.que: SPHEAL is much faster rolling than  walking to get around. When groups of this POKéMON eat, they all clap at once to show their pleasure. Because of this, their mealtimes are noisy.

364.name: sealeo
364.que: SEALEO has the habit of always juggling on the tip of its nose anything it sees for the first time. This POKéMON occasionally entertains itself by balancing and rolling a SPHEAL on its nose.

365.name: walrein
365.que: It swims through icy seas while shattering ice floes with its large tusks. It is protected by its thick blubber.

366.name: clamperl
366.que: CLAMPERL’s sturdy shell is not only good for protection - it is also used for clamping and catching prey. A fully grown CLAMPERL’s shell will be scored with nicks and scratches all over.

367.name: huntail
367.que: HUNTAIL’s presence went unnoticed by people for a long time because it lives at extreme depths in the sea. This POKéMON’s eyes can see clearly even in the murky dark depths of the ocean.

369.name: relicanth
369.que: RELICANTH is a POKéMON species that existed for a hundred million years without ever changing its form. This ancient POKéMON feeds on microscopic organisms with its toothless mouth.

370.name: luvdisc
370.que: LUVDISC live in shallow seas in the tropics. This heart-shaped POKéMON earned its name by swimming after loving couples it spotted in the ocean’s waves.

371.name: bagon
371.que: Dreaming of one day flying, it practices by leaping off cliffs every day.

372.name: shelgon
372.que: Inside SHELGON’s armor-like shell, cells are in the midst of transformation to create an entirely new body. This POKéMON’s shell is extremely heavy, making its movements sluggish.

373.name: salamence
373.que: SALAMENCE came about as a result of a strong, long-held dream of growing wings. It is said that this powerful desire triggered a sudden mutation in this POKéMON’s cells, causing it to sprout its magnificent wings.

375.name: metang
375.que: When two BELDUM fuse together, METANG is formed. The brains of the BELDUM are joined by a magnetic nervous system. By linking its brains magnetically, this POKéMON generates strong psychokinetic power.

376.name: metagross
376.que: METAGROSS has four brains in total. Combined, the four brains can breeze through difficult calculations faster than a supercomputer. This POKéMON can float in the air by tucking in its four legs.

377.name: regirock
377.que: Its entire body is made of rock. If any part chips off in battle, it attaches rocks to repair itself.

378.name: regice
378.que: REGICE’s body was made during an ice age. The deep-frozen body can’t be melted, even by fire. This POKéMON controls frigid air of minus 328 degrees F.

379.name: registeel
379.que: REGISTEEL has a body that is harder than any kind of metal. Its body is apparently hollow. No one has any idea what this POKéMON eats.

380.name: latias
380.que: LATIAS is highly sensitive to the emotions of people. If it senses any hostility, this POKéMON ruffles the feathers all over its body and cries shrilly to intimidate the foe.

381.name: latios
381.que: LATIOS has the ability to make its foe see an image of what it has seen or imagines in its head. This POKéMON is intelligent and understands human speech.

382.name: kyogre
382.que: KYOGRE has the power to create massive rain clouds that cover the entire sky and bring about torrential downpours. This POKéMON saved people who were suffering from droughts.

384.name: rayquaza
384.que: RAYQUAZA lived for hundreds of millions of years in the earth’s ozone layer,  never descending to the ground. This POKéMON appears to feed on water and particles in the atmosphere.

385.name: jirachi
385.que: A legend states that JIRACHI will make true any wish that is written on notes attached to its head when it awakens. If this POKéMON senses danger, it will fight without awakening.

386.name: deoxys
386.que: The DNA of a space virus underwent a sudden mutation upon exposure to a laser beam and resulted in DEOXYS. The crystalline organ on this POKéMON’s chest appears to be its brain.

387.name: turtwig
387.que: Made from soil, the shell on its back hardens when it drinks water. It lives along lakes.

388.name: grotle
388.que: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.

389.name: torterra
389.que: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.

390.name: chimchar
390.que: It agilely scales sheer cliffs to live atop craggy mountains. Its fire is put out when it sleeps.

391.name: monferno
391.que: To intimidate attackers, it stretches the fire on its tail to make itself appear bigger.

392.name: infernape
392.que: It uses a special kind of martial arts involving all its limbs. Its fire never goes out.

393.name: piplup
393.que: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

394.name: prinplup
394.que: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.

395.name: empoleon
395.que: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.

396.name: starly
396.que: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.

397.name: staravia
397.que: It flies around forests and fields in search of bug Pokémon. It stays within a huge flock.

398.name: staraptor
398.que: It has a savage nature. It will courageously challenge foes that are much larger.

399.name: bidoof
399.que: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.

400.name: bibarel
400.que: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.

401.name: kricketot
401.que: It shakes its head back to front, causing its antennae to hit each other and sound like a xylophone.

402.name: kricketune
402.que: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.

403.name: shinx
403.que: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

405.name: luxray
405.que: It has eyes that can see through anything. It spots and captures prey hiding behind objects.

406.name: budew
406.que: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.

408.name: cranidos
408.que: It lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its skull is as hard as iron.

409.name: rampardos
409.que: Its powerful head butt has enough power to shatter even the most durable things upon impact.

410.name: shieldon
410.que: A Pokémon that lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its facial hide is extremely hard.

411.name: bastiodon
411.que: Any frontal attack is repulsed. It is a docile Pokémon that feeds on grass and berries.

412.name: burmy
412.que: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.

413.name: wormadam
413.que: When BURMY evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.

414.name: mothim
414.que: It loves the honey of flowers and steals honey collected by COMBEE.

415.name: combee
415.que: A Pokémon formed by three others. It busily carries sweet floral honey to VESPIQUEN.

416.name: vespiquen
416.que: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by COMBEE.

417.name: pachirisu
417.que: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.

418.name: buizel
418.que: It has a flotation sac that is like an inflatable collar. It floats on water with its head out.

419.name: floatzel
419.que: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.

421.name: cherrim
421.que: It blooms during times of strong sunlight. It tries to make up for everything it endured as a bud.

422.name: shellos
422.que: Its colors and shapes differ from region to region. In the Sinnoh region, two types are confirmed.

424.name: ambipom
424.que: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.

425.name: drifloon
425.que: A Pokémon formed by the spirits of people and Pokémon. It loves damp, humid seasons.

426.name: drifblim
426.que: At dusk, swarms of them are carried aloft on winds. When noticed, they suddenly vanish.

427.name: buneary
427.que: It slams foes by sharply uncoiling its rolled ears. It stings enough to make a grown-up cry in pain.

428.name: lopunny
428.que: An extremely cautious Pokémon. It cloaks its body with its fluffy ear fur when it senses danger.

429.name: mismagius
429.que: Its cries sound like incantations. Those hearing it are tormented by headaches and hallucinations.

430.name: honchkrow
430.que: Becoming active at night, it is known to swarm with numerous MURKROW in tow.

431.name: glameow
431.que: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.

432.name: purugly
432.que: It is a brazen brute that barges its way into another Pokémon’s nest and claims it as its own.

433.name: chingling
433.que: It emits cries by agitating an orb at the back of its throat. It moves with flouncing hops.

434.name: stunky
434.que: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.

435.name: skuntank
435.que: It sprays a vile-smelling fluid from the tip of its tail to attack. Its range is over 160 feet.

437.name: bronzong
437.que: One caused a news sensation when it was dug up at a construction site after a 2,000-year sleep.

438.name: bonsly
438.que: It looks as if it is always crying. It is actually adjusting its body’s fluid levels by eliminating excess.

439.name: mime-jr
439.que: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokémon.

440.name: happiny
440.que: It loves round white things. It carries an egg-shaped rock in imitation of CHANSEY.

441.name: chatot
441.que: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

442.name: spiritomb
442.que: A Pokémon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an odd keystone.

443.name: gible
443.que: It nests in small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.

444.name: gabite
444.que: There is a long-held belief that medicine made from its scales will heal even incurable illnesses.

445.name: garchomp
445.que: When it folds up its body and extends its wings, it looks like a jet plane. It flies at sonic speed.

446.name: munchlax
446.que: It wolfs down its weight in food once a day, swallowing food whole with almost no chewing.

447.name: riolu
447.que: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.

448.name: lucario
448.que: It has the ability to sense the auras of all things. It understands human speech.

449.name: hippopotas
449.que: It lives in arid places. Instead of perspiration, it expels grainy sand from its body.

450.name: hippowdon
450.que: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.

451.name: skorupi
451.que: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.

452.name: drapion
452.que: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.

453.name: croagunk
453.que: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.

454.name: toxicroak
454.que: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.

455.name: carnivine
455.que: It attracts prey with its sweet- smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.

458.name: mantyke
458.que: A friendly Pokémon that captures the subtle flows of seawater using its two antennae.

459.name: snover
459.que: It lives on snowy mountains. Having had little contact with humans, it is boldly inquisitive.

460.name: abomasnow
460.que: It whips up blizzards in mountains that are always buried in snow. It is the abominable snowman.

461.name: weavile
461.que: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.

462.name: magnezone
462.que: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.

464.name: rhyperior
464.que: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. GEODUDE are shot at rare times.

465.name: tangrowth
465.que: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.

466.name: electivire
466.que: As its electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.

467.name: magmortar
467.que: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees F from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.

469.name: yanmega
469.que: By churning its wings, it creates shock waves that inflict critical internal injuries to foes.

470.name: leafeon
470.que: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.

471.name: glaceon
471.que: As a protective technique, it can completely freeze its fur to make its hairs stand like needles.

472.name: gliscor
472.que: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!

473.name: mamoswine
473.que: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.

474.name: porygon-z
474.que: Additional software was installed to make it a better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.

476.name: probopass
476.que: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.

478.name: froslass
478.que: It freezes foes with an icy breath nearly -60 degrees F. What seems to be its body is actually hollow.

480.name: uxie
480.que: Known as “The Being of Knowledge.” It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.

481.name: mesprit
481.que: Known as “The Being of Emotion.” It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.

482.name: azelf
482.que: Known as “The Being of Willpower.” It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.

483.name: dialga
483.que: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

484.name: palkia
484.que: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.

485.name: heatran
485.que: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.

486.name: regigigas
486.que: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.

487.name: giratina
487.que: A Pokémon that is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours. It appears in an ancient cemetery.

488.name: cresselia
488.que: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

490.name: manaphy
490.que: Born on a cold seafloor, it will swim great distances to return to its birthplace.

491.name: darkrai
491.que: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

493.name: arceus
493.que: It is described in mythology as the Pokémon that shaped the universe with its 1,000 arms.

522.name: blitzle
522.que: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.

627.name: rufflet
627.que: They crush berries with their talons. They bravely stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong it is.

629.name: vullaby
629.que: Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly. They guard their posteriors with bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.

634.name: zweilous
634.que: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.

648.name: meloetta
648.que: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.

668.name: pyroar
668.que: The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride.

771.name: pyukumuku
771.que: It’s covered in a slime that keeps its skin moist, allowing it to stay on land for days without drying up.

899.name: wyrdeer
899.que: The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the Pokémon is erecting invisible barriers. The fur shed from its beard retains heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.

900.name: kleavor
900.que: A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone. If one should chance upon this Pokémon in the wilds, one's only recourse is to flee.

901.name: ursaluna
901.que: I believe it was Hisui's swampy terrain that gave Ursaluna its burly physique and newfound capacity to manipulate peat at will.

902.name: basculegion
902.que: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui's rivers is Basculegion's equal.

903.name: sneasler
903.que: Because of Sneasler's virulent poison and daunting physical prowess, no other species could hope to best it on the frozen highlands. Preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.

904.name: overqwil
904.que: Its lancelike spikes and savage temperament have earned it the nickname ”sea fiend.” It slurps up poison to nourish itself.

905.name: enamorus
905.que: When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémon's love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.
